intro: Rhexia dichrananthera, commonly known as the pinkroot, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its striking pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and is often found in pine flatwoods and wetlands. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its roots are tuberous and contribute to its common name. Rhexia dichrananthera plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest in ecological restoration projects.
